alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 11:59PM MST until September 12 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 300 AM MST. * At 1157 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Agua Fria River basin north and east of Cordes Junction. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in less than one hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area through 1 AM MST. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 264 and 271. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Badger Spring Wash, Big Bug Creek, Yarber Wash, Osborne Spring Wash, Bishop Creek, Little Ash Creek, Sycamore Creek, Ash Creek, Dry Creek, Brushy Wash, Agua Fria River, Indian Creek and Silver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
